chunks.content: 1. In the **Open Workflow** tab, click **Open From Repository**. The **Workflows** frame of the Repository opens. [IMAGE] 2. Select a folder in the left pane. 3. Choose a workflow in the right pane to see its details. [IMAGE] 4. Click the three-dot actions menu in the upper right corner and select **Open**.
chunks.originalContent:
1.  In the **Open Workflow** tab, click **Open From Repository**.  
  The **Workflows** frame of the Repository opens.  
  ![Open Workflow from Repository](img/workflow-repository.png)
2.  Select a folder in the left pane.
3.  Choose a workflow in the right pane to see its details.  
    ![Open Workflow from Repository Details](img/workflow-repository-details.png)
4.  Click the three-dot actions menu in the upper right corner and select **Open**.
chunks.header: Opening a Workflow from the Repository

chunks.content: The Workflow Designer provides two save options: * **Save:** Saves all changes made since the last save. See [LINK]. * **Save As:** Creates a new workflow or template based on the current one. See [LINK]. Both options are available from the icon action bar: [IMAGE]
chunks.originalContent:
The Workflow Designer provides two save options:

*   **Save:** Saves all changes made since the last save. See [Using the Save Action](#using-the-save-action).
*   **Save As:** Creates a new workflow or template based on the current one. See [Using the Save As Option](#using-the-save-as-option).
    
Both options are available from the icon action bar:

![Workflow Designer Toolbar](img/1638e0052da6a6.png)

chunks.content: Click the save icon [IMAGE] to preserve your recent changes. The Workflow Designer does **not** auto-save. Save your work frequently to avoid losing changes. If you try to close a workflow without saving, you'll be prompted to do so.
chunks.originalContent:
Click the save icon

![Save](img/1638e004f5353b.png)

to preserve your recent changes. 

The Workflow Designer does **not** auto-save. Save your work frequently to avoid losing changes.

If you try to close a workflow without saving, you'll be prompted to do so.

chunks.content: Use **Save As** to duplicate a workflow or convert between a workflow and a template. Click the **Save As** icon [IMAGE] to open the dialog: [IMAGE] Then: 1. Choose whether to save as a **workflow** or a **template**. 2. Update the **Name** and **Description**, if needed. 3. Add or remove **Tags**. (See [LINK].) 4. If saving as a workflow, set **Permissions**. (See[LINK].) 5. If saving as a template, you can optionally change the template image. 6. Choose whether to **Create a new revision.** This option may be locked if the workflow is in use (e.g., in production). 7. Click **Save** to finish.
chunks.originalContent:
Use **Save As** to duplicate a workflow or convert between a workflow and a template.

Click the **Save As** icon ![Save as](img/1638e004f59af6.png) to open the dialog:

![Workflow Designer Save As](img/1638e0052ecb54.png)

Then:

1. Choose whether to save as a **workflow** or a **template**.
2. Update the **Name** and **Description**, if needed.
3. Add or remove **Tags**. (See [Adding New Tags](./add-tags.mdx).)
4. If saving as a workflow, set **Permissions**. (See[Assigning Permissions to a Workflow](../workflow-settings.mdx).)
5. If saving as a template, you can optionally change the template image.
6. Choose whether to **Create a new revision.**

This option may be locked if the workflow is in use (e.g., in production).

7. Click **Save** to finish.

chunks.content: Templates are sample workflows that provide a foundation for building workflows for specific scenarios. All available templates (both pre-built and those you customize) are listed in the **Templates** tab of the Workflow Designer. Open the list of templates by clicking the **Templates** button in the upper left corner of the Designer. The list is organized according to category. The numbers on the right side of each row indicate the number of templates in that category. Clicking **New** displays a list of templates that you created in the last 30 days. New pre-built templates included in recent VAR::PRODUCT_FULL version updates also appear in this list. Expanding a category opens a list of the templates included in that category. You can add a template to your workflow by dragging and dropping it onto the canvas.
chunks.originalContent:
Templates are sample workflows that provide a foundation for building workflows for specific scenarios. All available templates (both pre-built and those you customize) are listed in the **Templates** tab of the Workflow Designer.

Open the list of templates by clicking the **Templates** button in the upper left corner of the Designer. The list is organized according to category. The numbers on the right side of each row indicate the number of templates in that category.

Clicking **New** displays a list of templates that you created in the last 30 days. New pre-built templates included in recent VAR::PRODUCT_FULL version updates also appear in this list.

Expanding a category opens a list of the templates included in that category. You can add a template to your workflow by dragging and dropping it onto the canvas.

chunks.content: The Workflow Designer supports version control by letting you create and manage multiple revisions of workflows and templates. (See [LINK] for how to create revisions.) To see the revisions history: - Click the three-dot menu next to a workflow or template. - Select **History** to open the History dialog.
chunks.originalContent:
The Workflow Designer supports version control by letting you create and manage multiple revisions of workflows and templates. (See [Saving Your Workflow](./save-workflow.mdx) for how to create revisions.) 

To see the revisions history: 
- Click the three-dot menu next to a workflow or template. 
- Select **History** to open the History dialog.

chunks.content: The top section of the **History** dialog shows data about the most recent (Active) revision, even if it is not currently open. [IMAGE] Details include: * **Name**Title of the Active revision. * **Active**—Revision number. * **Description**—Summary of changes or notes. * **Information**—Additional content in Rich Text Format (RTF). * **Tags**—Keywords for organization and search. * **Saved**—Timestamp of the last save. * **Previous** (Click the expand arrow) Previous revisions.
chunks.originalContent:
The top section of the **History** dialog shows data about the most recent (Active) revision, even if it is not currently open. 

![Workflow Designer Revision History Current](img/1638e00532f499.png)

Details include:

* **Name**Title of the Active revision.
* **Active**—Revision number.
* **Description**—Summary of changes or notes.
* **Information**—Additional content in Rich Text Format (RTF).
* **Tags**—Keywords for organization and search.
* **Saved**—Timestamp of the last save.
* **Previous** (Click the expand arrow) Previous revisions.

chunks.content: To view earlier versions: 1. Expand the **Previous** frame at the bottom of the **History** dialog. 2. Click a revision number to view details. 3. Click **Open Workflow** to open it in the Workflow Designer. When a revision other than the Active revision, the revision number is displayed as part of the name in the workflow tab. :::note If you have closed the Active revision, you cannot reopen it from the **History** tab. Open it by selecting it from the [LINK]. :::
chunks.originalContent:
To view earlier versions:

1. Expand the **Previous** frame at the bottom of the **History** dialog.
2. Click a revision number to view details.
3. Click **Open Workflow** to open it in the Workflow Designer.

When a revision other than the Active revision, the revision number is displayed as part of the name in the workflow tab.

:::note
If you have closed the Active revision, you cannot reopen it from the **History** tab. Open it by selecting it from the [list on the Welcome screen](../../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/workflow-dashboard.mdx).
:::

chunks.content: The **Error** tab in the Activity Details dialog allows you to specify what happens if the activity fails to execute. You can choose from four general handling categories using the dropdown list on the **Error** tab. [IMAGE] To assign multiple error handling options: 1. Open the dropdown list. 2. Select additional categories as needed. The selected options are applied in the order they appear. For example: [IMAGE] It is recommended to define error handling for every activity, especially those that occur before critical steps in your workflow.
chunks.originalContent:
The **Error** tab in the Activity Details dialog allows you to specify what happens if the activity fails to execute. You can choose from four general handling categories using the dropdown list on the **Error** tab.

![Workflow Designer Error Handling Dropdown](img/1638e00516f9bf.png)

To assign multiple error handling options:
1. Open the dropdown list.
2. Select additional categories as needed.

The selected options are applied in the order they appear. For example:

![Workflow Designer Error Handling Selection](img/1638e005176a82.png)

It is recommended to define error handling for every activity, especially those that occur before critical steps in your workflow.

chunks.content: The **Notes** tab of the Activity Details dialog allows you to enter comments about the activity. Notes can include a description, its role in the workflow, or any other helpful context. **Recommendation:** Add a note for each activity to improve workflow clarity and collaboration. To add or update a note: 1. Enter your text in the **Notes** field. 2. Click **Save.** All notes for a workflow appear at the bottom of the **Documentation** dialog. [IMAGE] [IMAGE]
chunks.originalContent:
The **Notes** tab of the Activity Details dialog allows you to enter comments about the activity. Notes can include a description, its role in the workflow, or any other helpful context. 

**Recommendation:** Add a note for each activity to improve workflow clarity and collaboration.

To add or update a note:

1. Enter your text in the **Notes** field.
2. Click **Save.**

All notes for a workflow appear at the bottom of the **Documentation** dialog.

![Workflow Designer WF Context Documentation](img/1638e005183a76.png)

![documentationdialog_notes.png](img/1638e00518ba2e.png)

chunks.content: The Execute function runs a workflow and then displays a log providing information related to the execution of each activity. You can change the settings of the log to display more (or less) detail, as needed. To run a workflow: * Click the [IMAGE] icon form the Designer toolbar. The workflow is executed, and the execution log is displayed at the bottom of the screen. :::note To abort execution while the workflow is running, click the Abort (stop) button [IMAGE]. :::
chunks.originalContent:
The Execute function runs a workflow and then displays a log providing information related to the execution of each activity. You can change the settings of the log to display more (or less) detail, as needed.

To run a workflow:

*   Click the ![Run](img/1638e004f66ba1.png) icon form the Designer toolbar.  
    The workflow is executed, and the execution log is displayed at the bottom of the screen.

:::note
To abort execution while the workflow is running, click the Abort (stop) button ![Abort.png](img/1638e004f6d9f4.png).
:::

chunks.content: The Verify function checks a workflow for valid configuration, ensuring all components (e.g., activity settings) are properly defined. Run verification before saving or executing the workflow. To verify a workflow: * Click the three-dot menu on the left side of the [LINK] and select **Verify**. A confirmation message will appear on a valid workflow. An Error Log will appear at the bottom of the screen for an invalid workflow. Each row of the Log displays the name of the component that failed verification and a description of the error involved.
chunks.originalContent:
The Verify function checks a workflow for valid configuration, ensuring all components (e.g., activity settings) are properly defined. Run verification before saving or executing the workflow.

To verify a workflow:

*   Click the three-dot menu on the left side of the [workflow tab](./workflow-dashboard.mdx) and select **Verify**.  
    A confirmation message will appear on a valid workflow.  
    An Error Log will appear at the bottom of the screen for an invalid workflow. Each row of the Log displays the name of the component that failed verification and a description of the error involved.

chunks.content: Log in to VAR::PRODUCT_FULL and open the Navigation menu: To open the Workflow Designer, open the **Main Menu** and then select **Builder > Workflow Designer**. The Workflow Designer opens with a **Welcome** window: [IMAGE] :::note For a short video tutorial on using the Workflow Designer, in the upper-right corner of the Welcome screen, click **Learning Center**. :::
chunks.originalContent:
Log in to VAR::PRODUCT_FULL and open the Navigation menu:

To open the Workflow Designer, open the **Main Menu** and then select **Builder > Workflow Designer**.

The Workflow Designer opens with a **Welcome** window:
    
![Create Workflow](img/workflow-welcome.png)
    
:::note
For a short video tutorial on using the Workflow Designer, in the upper-right corner of the Welcome screen, click **Learning Center**.
:::

chunks.content: If you last quit the Workflow Designer without closing the workflow(s) you were building, a **Currently working on** quick start bar appears when you next access the Designer from the Navigation menu. To launch the Designer and open a specific workflow at the same time, select the workflow from the quick start bar. [IMAGE] If you do not use the quick start bar and launch the Designer by clicking **Workflow Designer** (from the navigation menu), the Designer automatically opens with all previously open workflows displayed.
chunks.originalContent:
If you last quit the Workflow Designer without closing the workflow(s) you were building, a **Currently working on** quick start bar appears when you next access the Designer from the Navigation menu. To launch the Designer and open a specific workflow at the same time, select the workflow from the quick start bar.

![Currently Working On](img/currently-working-on.png)

If you do not use the quick start bar and launch the Designer by clicking **Workflow Designer** (from the navigation menu), the Designer automatically opens with all previously open workflows displayed.

chunks.content: This section presents the main components of the Workflow Designer main window and explains how to use them. In the figure below, the main components are numbered. A key is provided in the table following the figure. [IMAGE] ##### 1—Toolbox Lists all the activities and controls that you can use in your workflow. For more information, refer to [LINK]. ##### 2—Templates Lists all the templates that you can add to your workflow. For more information, refer to [LINK]. ##### 3—Workflow tabs List the names of the workflows that are currently open. Clicking the plus icon opens the [LINK], from which you can create or open an additional workflow. Clicking the three dots opens a further menu that allows you to perform the following actions: * Documentation—[LINK] * Verify—[LINK] * History—[LINK] * Export—[LINK] ##### 4—Designer toolbar Provides one-click access to common actions related to building a workflow. For details, refer to [LINK]. ##### 5—Canvas The drawing board of the Workflow Designer. ##### 6—Reference toolbar Provides viewing tools (such as resizing) the workflow layout and searching for workflow components. ##### 7—Variables sidebar Provides quick access to the workflow's local variables, the global variables, and the module variables. For more information, see [LINK].
chunks.originalContent:
This section presents the main components of the Workflow Designer main window and explains how to use them. In the figure below, the main components are numbered. A key is provided in the table following the figure.

![Workflow Designer Example](img/wd-main-window.png)

##### 1—Toolbox

Lists all the activities and controls that you can use in your workflow. For more information, refer to [Understanding the Toolbox](#understanding-the-toolbox).

##### 2—Templates

Lists all the templates that you can add to your workflow. For more information, refer to [Using the List of Templates](./Workflow-File-Options/using-the-list-of-templates.mdx).

##### 3—Workflow tabs

List the names of the workflows that are currently open. Clicking the plus icon opens the [Welcome screen](./Workflow-File-Options/open-workflow.mdx), from which you can create or open an additional workflow.

Clicking the three dots opens a further menu that allows you to perform the following actions:

* Documentation—[View and update description, tags, and notes](./verify-workflows.mdx)
* Verify—[Verify the workflow](./verify-workflows.mdx)
* History—[View revision history](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/Workflow-File-Options/workflow-revisions.mdx)
* Export—[Export the workflow](./Workflow-File-Options/export-workflow.mdx)

##### 4—Designer toolbar

Provides one-click access to common actions related to building a workflow. For details, refer to [The Designer Toolbar](#the-designer-toolbar).

##### 5—Canvas

The drawing board of the Workflow Designer.

##### 6—Reference toolbar

Provides viewing tools (such as resizing) the workflow layout and searching for workflow components. 

##### 7—Variables sidebar

Provides quick access to the workflow's local variables, the global variables, and the module variables. For more information, see [Creating a Data Flow](../../Building-Your-Workflow/Variables/create-a-data-flow.mdx).

chunks.content: The Toolbox offers two classes of resources that you can use to build your workflows: * **Activities** are operative actions that make up the workflow process. An activity can be deleting a folder, adding a user, retrieving CPU data, and so on. In the Toolbox, activities are grouped according to category. Each category is represented by an icon (on the left side of the activity row). * **Controls** are functions or logic expressions that determine the direction in which the workflow progresses. Examples include conditions and If-else controls. When you hover over an activity or a control, the following icons appear: | Icon | Description | |---|---| | [IMAGE] | Toggle. Indicates that the activity or control has been removed from your Favorites list. | | [IMAGE] | Toggle. Indicates that the activity or control has been added to your Favorites list. | | [IMAGE] | Hovering over this icon displays a tooltip describing the activity or control. | Both activities and controls can be added to the workflow by dragging and dropping them onto the canvas. For more information, refer to [LINK].
chunks.originalContent:
The Toolbox offers two classes of resources that you can use to build your workflows:

* **Activities** are operative actions that make up the workflow process. An activity can be deleting a folder, adding a user, retrieving CPU data, and so on. In the Toolbox, activities are grouped according to category. Each category is represented by an icon (on the left side of the activity row).
* **Controls** are functions or logic expressions that determine the direction in which the workflow progresses. Examples include conditions and If-else controls.  

When you hover over an activity or a control, the following icons appear:

| Icon | Description |
|---|---|
| ![Favorite Off](img/1638e004f1c950.png) | Toggle. Indicates that the activity or control has been removed from your Favorites list. |
| ![Favorite On](img/1638e004f2349b.png) | Toggle. Indicates that the activity or control has been added to your Favorites list. |
| ![Online Help](img/1638e004c3f199.png) | Hovering over this icon displays a tooltip describing the activity or control. |

Both activities and controls can be added to the workflow by dragging and dropping them onto the canvas. For more information, refer to [Adding Activities](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/Add-Activities/introduction-to-adding-activities.mdx).

chunks.content: This toolbar provides one-click access to actions that are frequently performed when building a workflow. | Icon | Action | Description | |---|---|---| | [IMAGE] | Undo | Removes the last edit done to the workflow. | | [IMAGE] | Redo | Restores the change that was last removed using the Undo action. | | [LINK]. | | [LINK]. | | [LINK]. | | [LINK]. | | [IMAGE] | Abort | Stops execution of a running workflow. | | [IMAGE] | Help | Opens the online help for the Workflow Designer. |
chunks.originalContent:
This toolbar provides one-click access to actions that are frequently performed when building a workflow.

| Icon | Action | Description |
|---|---|---|
| ![Undo.png](img/1638e004f466b9.png) | Undo | Removes the last edit done to the workflow. |
| ![Redo.png](img/1638e004f4cc64.png) | Redo | Restores the change that was last removed using the Undo action. |
| ![Save.png](img/1638e004f5353b.png) | Save | Saves all changes made to the workflow since the last Save action. For details, refer to [Saving Your Workflow](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/Workflow-File-Options/save-workflow.mdx). |
| ![Save_as.png](img/1638e004f59af6.png) | Save As | Allows you to save the current workflow as an additional workflow or as a template. For more information, refer to [Saving Your Workflow](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/Workflow-File-Options/save-workflow.mdx). |
| ![SetVariablesButton.png](img/1638e004f60799.png) | Set Variables | Allows you to set variables for the workflow that you're working on to either test or manually run it with actual values. For details, refer to [Settings Variables in Workflows](../../Building-Your-Workflow/Variables/set-variables-in-workflows.mdx). |
| ![Run_1.png](img/1638e004f66ba1.png) | Run | Executes the workflow. For more information, refer to [Running Workflows](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/run-workflow.mdx). |
| ![Abort.png](img/1638e004f6d9f4.png) | Abort | Stops execution of a running workflow. |
| ![Help.png](img/1638e004f74327.png) | Help | Opens the online help for the Workflow Designer. |

chunks.content: The **Documentation** dialog displays the following data about a workflow: * [LINK]: General summary and additional details. * [LINK]: Keywords for organizing and searching. * [LINK]: Annotations tied to specific workflow activities. [IMAGE]
chunks.originalContent:
The **Documentation** dialog displays the following data about a workflow:

*   [Description and information text](#reviewing-description-and-information-text): General summary and additional details. 
*   [Tags](#managing-tags): Keywords for organizing and searching.
*   [Notes](#viewing-notes): Annotations tied to specific workflow activities.

![Workflow Designer Documentation](img/1638e00534aaac.png)

chunks.content: To access metadata: * Click the three-dot menu and select **Documentation** on the [LINK].
chunks.originalContent:
To access metadata: 

* Click the three-dot menu and select **Documentation** on the [workflow tab](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/workflow-navigation.mdx).

chunks.content: The top of the **Documentation** dialog displays: * **Description:** A summary of the workflow's purpose and use cases. * **Information:** Additional HTML-formatted content. To edit these fields: 1. Click in the **Information** section. 2. Enter or update text using the formatting toolbar. 3. Click **OK** to save changes.
chunks.originalContent:
The top of the **Documentation** dialog displays:

*   **Description:** A summary of the workflow's purpose and use cases.
*   **Information:** Additional HTML-formatted content. 

To edit these fields:

1.  Click in the **Information** section.
2.  Enter or update text using the formatting toolbar.
3.  Click **OK** to save changes.

chunks.content: Tags help categorize workflows and improve searchability. * Add or delete tags directly in the **Documentation** dialog. [IMAGE] For details on creating tags, see [LINK]. Click **OK** to save your changes after editing tags.
chunks.originalContent:
Tags help categorize workflows and improve searchability. 

* Add or delete tags directly in the **Documentation** dialog.

![Workflow Designer Documentation_3.png](img/1638e005358796.png)

For details on creating tags, see [Adding New Tags](../../Product-Navigation/Workflow-Designer/Workflow-File-Options/add-tags.mdx).

Click **OK** to save your changes after editing tags.

chunks.content: Notes provide context or instructions for specific activities in a workflow. In the **Documentation** dialog: * The **Notes** section lists all notes in the workflow. * A counter next to the title shows the number of notes. * The grid lists: * Activities that contain notes (in workflow order). * The content of each note.
chunks.originalContent:
Notes provide context or instructions for specific activities in a workflow.

In the **Documentation** dialog: 
* The **Notes** section lists all notes in the workflow.
* A counter next to the title shows the number of notes. 
* The grid lists:
  * Activities that contain notes (in workflow order).
  * The content of each note.

chunks.content: The Reference toolbar, in the upper-right corner of the Workflow Designer, offers tools for viewing your workflow layout and locating specific components. In normal operation, the toolbar appears as follows: [IMAGE] Clicking the Minimap icon [IMAGE] opens a view of the entire workflow: [IMAGE] A movable orange locator frame lets you focus on a specific portion of the workflow: [IMAGE] To move around the workflow, click and drag the orange box in the Minimap. As you move the box, the visible portion of the canvas updates in real time. This is useful when working with workflows that are too large to fit on the screen. The Reference toolbar includes the following tools: | Icon | Tool | Description | |---|---|---| | [IMAGE] [IMAGE] | Zoom In/ Zoom Out | Increases or decreases the zoom level on the canvas. | | [IMAGE] | Minimap | Shows a compact visual overview of the entire workflow, allowing easy navigation to different areas. | | [IMAGE] | Filter By Layer | Highlights workflow components that include notes and/or error handling. . | | [IMAGE] | Search Activity | Finds activities within the workflow using keyword searches. |
chunks.originalContent:
The Reference toolbar, in the upper-right corner of the Workflow Designer, offers tools for viewing your workflow layout and locating specific components. In normal operation, the toolbar appears as follows:

![Workflow Designer Minimap Toolbar Closed](img/1638e00520e56f.png)

Clicking the Minimap icon ![Minimap.png](img/1638e005214e07.png) opens a view of the entire workflow:

![Workflow Designer Minimap Toolbar Open](img/1638e00521aa46.png)

A movable orange locator frame lets you focus on a specific portion of the workflow:

![Workflow Designer Minimap Toolbar Open Full](img/1638e0052217b9.png)

To move around the workflow, click and drag the orange box in the Minimap. As you move the box, the visible portion of the canvas updates in real time. This is useful when working with workflows that are too large to fit on the screen.

The Reference toolbar includes the following tools:

| Icon | Tool | Description |
|---|---|---|
| ![Zoom in](img/1638e005228760.png) ![Zoom out](img/1638e00522dd35.png) | Zoom In/ Zoom Out | Increases or decreases the zoom level on the canvas. |
| ![Minimap.png](img/1638e005214e07.png) | Minimap | Shows a compact visual overview of the entire workflow, allowing easy navigation to different areas. |
| ![Minimap_Filter.png](img/1638e0052371ca.png) | Filter By Layer | Highlights workflow components that include notes and/or error handling. . |
| ![Minimap_Search.png](img/1638e00523cf81.png) | Search Activity | Finds activities within the workflow using keyword searches. |

chunks.content: Use the **zoom tool** to change the size of the workflow view on the canvas. - Click the **plus icon** to zoom in and focus on smaller areas or individual components. - Click the **minus icon** to zoom out and view more of the workflow layout. You can drag the zoom slider for faster control. You can adjust zoom by scrolling while the mouse pointer is inside the Minimap.
chunks.originalContent:
Use the **zoom tool** to change the size of the workflow view on the canvas.

- Click the **plus icon** to zoom in and focus on smaller areas or individual components.
- Click the **minus icon** to zoom out and view more of the workflow layout. 

You can drag the zoom slider for faster control.

You can adjust zoom by scrolling while the mouse pointer is inside the Minimap.

chunks.content: For large or complex workflows, the **Minimap** is an essential navigation tool that helps you stay oriented and quickly reach the sections you need. The Minimap shows a small diagram of the entire workflow. The current visible area is marked by the **orange locator frame.** [IMAGE] You can navigate the workflow using either method: * **Drag the locator frame** inside the Minimap to reposition the canvas view. * **Drag the canvas** directly within the Workflow Designer to reposition the locator frame in the Minimap. To hide the Minimap, click the map icon: [IMAGE]
chunks.originalContent:
For large or complex workflows, the **Minimap** is an essential navigation tool that helps you stay oriented and quickly reach the sections you need. 

The Minimap shows a small diagram of the entire workflow. The current visible area is marked by the **orange locator frame.**

![Workflow Designer Minimap Toolbar Open](img/1638e00521aa46.png)

You can navigate the workflow using either method:

*   **Drag the locator frame** inside the Minimap to reposition the canvas view.
*   **Drag the canvas** directly within the Workflow Designer to reposition the locator frame in the Minimap.

To hide the Minimap, click the map icon: ![Minimap.png](img/1638e005214e07.png)

chunks.content: The **Filter By Layer** feature highlights workflow components that contain: * **Notes:** Additional comments or context about a component. * **Error Handling:** Instructions about actions to take if a component fails or encounters an issue. The example below shows a workflow filtered to highlight components that include notes. Highlighted components appear in full color. Others are grayed out. [IMAGE] :::note Grayed-out components are still active and editable. They will function as normal when the workflow runs. ::: To filter the workflow: 1. Click the **Filter** icon on the Reference toolbar.[IMAGE]. The **Filter By Layer** popup opens. 2. Uncheck **All**, then select **Notes** and/or **Error Handling** to apply specific filters.
chunks.originalContent:
The **Filter By Layer** feature highlights workflow components that contain:

*   **Notes:** Additional comments or context about a component.
*   **Error Handling:** Instructions about actions to take if a component fails or encounters an issue.
    
The example below shows a workflow filtered to highlight components that include notes. Highlighted components appear in full color. Others are grayed out.

![Workflow Designer Filtered Workflow Notes](img/1638e0052593bf.png)

:::note
Grayed-out components are still active and editable. They will function as normal when the workflow runs.
:::

To filter the workflow:

1.  Click the **Filter** icon on the Reference toolbar.![Minimap Filter](img/1638e0052371ca.png).  
    The **Filter By Layer** popup opens.  
2.  Uncheck **All**, then select **Notes** and/or **Error Handling** to apply specific filters.

chunks.content: Every workflow has one or more Owners and a set of permissions associated with it. An Owner is a user who manages permissions for the workflow. The set of permissions defines which users are allowed to access the workflow, and what actions they are authorized to perform on it. The **Permissions** frame of the **Save As** dialog enables workflow Owners to manage the permissions set for the workflow. Users/Groups that have permissions to access the workflow are listed on the left side of the frame. The permissions categories for which they are authorized are indicated on the right side of the frame. :::note Permissions are not relevant for templates. ::: Permissions categories are named according to actions. The categories are: * **Read**—Users are authorized to view the workflow in read-only format. * **Write**—Users are authorized to view and modify the workflow. * **Execute**—Users are authorized to execute the workflow. By default, these users are also automatically granted Read privileges, but not Write privileges. If an Owner removes Read permissions from a user with Execute permissions, that user may execute the workflow only from outside the Workflow Designer. * **Owner**—By default, Owners have Read, Write and Execute privileges. They also may manage the permissions set and delete the workflow. By default, the creator of a workflow is the Owner. An Owner may add and remove additional Owners and remove Owner permissions from other Owners. A workflow must have at least one Owner at any given time. The following procedures explain how to manage the permissions set from the **Save As** dialog. Only Owners are authorized to manage the permissions set. To add users/groups to the permissions set: 1. From the **Type** dropdown, select the relevant icon (User or Group). [IMAGE] 2. In the **User/Group** column, select the required user or group from the dropdown list. 3. Select the checkbox(es) of the permission(s) to be granted to the user or group. A workflow can have more than one owner. :::note Keep in mind that permissions granted to a user can be direct (permissions granted to the individual user) or indirect (permissions granted to groups of which the user is a member). For example, if a group has Write privileges, and User A (a member of that group) is added and assigned only Read privileges, User A will have both Read and Write privileges. ::: 4. To add another user or group, repeat the steps so far. To remove a user or a group, click the X icon in its row.
chunks.originalContent:
Every workflow has one or more Owners and a set of permissions associated with it. An Owner is a user who manages permissions for the workflow. The set of permissions defines which users are allowed to access the workflow, and what actions they are authorized to perform on it.

The **Permissions** frame of the **Save As** dialog enables workflow Owners to manage the permissions set for the workflow. Users/Groups that have permissions to access the workflow are listed on the left side of the frame. The permissions categories for which they are authorized are indicated on the right side of the frame.

:::note
Permissions are not relevant for templates.
:::

Permissions categories are named according to actions. The categories are:

* **Read**—Users are authorized to view the workflow in read-only format.
* **Write**—Users are authorized to view and modify the workflow.
* **Execute**—Users are authorized to execute the workflow. By default, these users are also automatically granted Read privileges, but not Write privileges.  
   If an Owner removes Read permissions from a user with Execute permissions, that user may execute the workflow only from outside the Workflow Designer.
* **Owner**—By default, Owners have Read, Write and Execute privileges. They also may manage the permissions set and delete the workflow. By default, the creator of a workflow is the Owner.  
   An Owner may add and remove additional Owners and remove Owner permissions from other Owners. A workflow must have at least one Owner at any given time.

The following procedures explain how to manage the permissions set from the **Save As** dialog. Only Owners are authorized to manage the permissions set.

To add users/groups to the permissions set:

1.  From the **Type** dropdown, select the relevant icon (User or Group).  
    ![Workflow Designer Save As Permissions](img/1638e005306e2f.png)
2.  In the **User/Group** column, select the required user or group from the dropdown list.
3.  Select the checkbox(es) of the permission(s) to be granted to the user or group.
    A workflow can have more than one owner.  
    :::note
    Keep in mind that permissions granted to a user can be direct (permissions granted to the individual user) or indirect (permissions granted to groups of which the user is a member). For example, if a group has Write privileges, and User A (a member of that group) is added and assigned only Read privileges, User A will have both Read and Write privileges.
    :::
4.  To add another user or group, repeat the steps so far.

To remove a user or a group, click the X icon in its row.

chunks.content: **Issue:** When I run the installer, I get a message that a technical error has occurred, and I’m advised to try again. **Possible resolution:** Verify that you can connect from your local computer to your cloud tenant before retrying. If you still receive the same error after that, it probably means that the installer can’t connect to the cloud environment for another reason. **Issue:** When I run the installer I get a message that one or more of the connection details are incorrect. **Possible Resolution:** Double-check that you have correctly entered all the values that you acquired in [LINK] before trying again. **Issue:** I am unable to successfully connect to the cloud environment and execute workflows even though my Internet connection is fine. **Possible Resolution:** In your firewall, open port 443 for communication with `https://bridge.resolveactions.com`.
chunks.originalContent:
**Issue:** When I run the installer, I get a message that a technical error has occurred, and I’m advised to try again.

**Possible resolution:** Verify that you can connect from your local computer to your cloud tenant before retrying. If you still receive the same error after that, it probably means that the installer can’t connect to the cloud environment for another reason.

**Issue:** When I run the installer I get a message that one or more of the connection details are incorrect.

**Possible Resolution:** Double-check that you have correctly entered all the values that you acquired in [Acquiring API Access Details](../Getting-Started/Setting-Up-Hybrid-Components/acquiring-api-access-details.mdx) before trying again.

**Issue:** I am unable to successfully connect to the cloud environment and execute workflows even though my Internet connection is fine.

**Possible Resolution:** In your firewall, open port 443 for communication with `https://bridge.resolveactions.com`.
